description: A avWlanSwitchMCPConnectionEstablished trap signifies that the SNMP entity
acting in an agent role, MCP client successfully established
connection with the MCP server in Wireless Controller.
The Trap is Enabled by default.
The type of address contained in a corresponding instance of
avWlanNotifAuxMobilityControllerInetAddress.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxMobilityControllerInetAddressType

description: This object identifies a controller network address.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxMobilityControllerInetAddress

description: A avWlanSwitchMCPLostConnection trap signifies that the SNMP entity
acting in an agent role, MCP client lost connection with the MCP server
in Wireless Controller.
The Trap is Enabled by default.
The type of address contained in a corresponding instance of
avWlanNotifAuxMobilityControllerInetAddress.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxMobilityControllerInetAddressType

description: This object identifies a controller network address.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxMobilityControllerInetAddress

description: A avWlanSwitchMVTDownload trap signifies that the SNMP entity
acting in an agent role, has received Mobility Vlan Table download
from the Mobility controller. Mobility Switch receives MVT when it
registers with the Mobility Controller. Controller address and number
of entries in the table is passed as parameter.
The Trap is Enabled by default.

event.Summary: WLAN switch MVT downloaded from the mobility controller

description: The type of address contained in a corresponding instance of
avWlanNotifAuxMobilityControllerInetAddress.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxMobilityControllerInetAddressType

description: This object identifies a controller network address.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxMobilityControllerInetAddress

description: This object identifies the number of Mobility VLAN entries
that were successfully downloaded by the WSP.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxNumberOfVlanEntries

description: A avWlanSwitchMSTDownload trap signifies that the SNMP entity
acting in an agent role, has received Mobility Switch Table download
from the Mobility Controller. Mobility Switch receives MST when it
registers with the Mobility controller. Controller address and number
of entries in the table is passed as parameter.
The Trap is Enabled by default.

event.Summary: WLAN switch MST downloaded from the mobility controller

description: The type of address contained in a corresponding instance of
avWlanNotifAuxMobilityControllerInetAddress.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxMobilityControllerInetAddressType

description: This object identifies a controller network address.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxMobilityControllerInetAddress

description: This object identifies the number of Mobility switches
that were successfully downloaded by the WSP.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxMSTDownloadEntries

description: A avWlanSwitchPeerDeviceConnectionEstablished trap signifies that the SNMP entity
acting in an agent role, has established connection to the peer device.
Peer switch IP, MAC address and device type is passed as parameter.
The Trap is Enabled by default.

event.Summary: WLAN switch peer device ($v4) connection established

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanSwitchPeerDeviceConnectionEstablished AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxPeerDeviceInetAddressType i 0 AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxPeerDeviceInetAddress s EXAMPLE AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxPeerDeviceAddress s EXAMPL AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxPeerDeviceType i 1

description: The type of address contained in a corresponding instance of
avWlanNotifAuxPeerDeviceInetAddress.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxPeerDeviceInetAddressType

description: This object identifies the IP address of any peer device connected
to the WSP.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxPeerDeviceInetAddress

description: This object specifies the MAC address of the peer device.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxPeerDeviceAddress

description: This object specifies the peer device type.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxPeerDeviceType

description: A avWlanSwitchPeerDeviceLostConnection trap signifies that the SNMP entity
acting in an agent role, has lost connection to the peer device.
Peer switch IP, MAC, device type and failure reason are passed as parameter.
The Trap is Enabled by default.

event.Summary: WLAN switch peer device ($v4) connection lost

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanSwitchPeerDeviceLostConnection AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxPeerDeviceInetAddressType i 0 AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxPeerDeviceInetAddress s EXAMPLE AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxPeerDeviceAddress s EXAMPL AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxPeerDeviceType i 1 AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxConnectionFailureReason i 1

description: The type of address contained in a corresponding instance of
avWlanNotifAuxPeerDeviceInetAddress.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxPeerDeviceInetAddressType

description: This object identifies the IP address of any peer device connected
to the WSP.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxPeerDeviceInetAddress

description: This object specifies the MAC address of the peer device.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxPeerDeviceAddress

description: This object specifies the peer device type.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxPeerDeviceType

description: This object indicate the reason for connection failure with
the peer device. The peer device is either a Access Point or
Wireless Switching Point. The supported values are:
kaLoss - loss of keep alive packets between the peers.
controlPlane - connection closed by the controller
peerReset - peer device closed the connection
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxConnectionFailureReason

description: A avWlanSwitchVlanServerElected trap signifies that the SNMP entity
acting in an agent role, has elected vlan server for a mobility vlan.
Mobility vlan name, vlan server IP and MAC address is passed as parameter.
The Trap is Disabled by default.

event.Summary: VLAN server $v3 elected for a mobility VLAN ($v1)

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanSwitchVlanServerElected AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxMobilityVlanName s EXAMPLE AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxVlanServerInetAddressType i 0 AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxVlanServerInetAddress s EXAMPLE AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxVlanServerAddress s EXAMPL

description: This object specifies the name of the mobility VLAN.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxMobilityVlanName

description: The type of address contained in a corresponding instance of
avWlanNotifAuxVlanServerInetAddress.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxVlanServerInetAddressType

description: This object identifies the IP address of VLAN server.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxVlanServerInetAddress

description: This object specifies the MAC address of the VLAN server.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxVlanServerAddress

description: A avWlanSwitchLostConnectionToVlanServer trap signifies that the SNMP entity
acting in an agent role, has lost connection to vlan server and there are no
other alternative vlan servers for the mobility vlan.
Mobility vlan name, vlan server IP and MAC address is passed as parameter.
The trap is Enabled by default.

event.Summary: WLAN switch lost connection too VLAN server

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanSwitchLostConnectionToVlanServer AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxMobilityVlanName s EXAMPLE AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxVlanServerInetAddressType i 0 AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxVlanServerInetAddress s EXAMPLE AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxVlanServerAddress s EXAMPL

description: This object specifies the name of the mobility VLAN.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxMobilityVlanName

description: The type of address contained in a corresponding instance of
avWlanNotifAuxVlanServerInetAddress.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxVlanServerInetAddressType

description: This object identifies the IP address of VLAN server.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxVlanServerInetAddress

description: This object specifies the MAC address of the VLAN server.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxVlanServerAddress

description: A avWlanSwitchVlanGenNumberMismatch trap signifies that the SNMP entity
acting in an agent role, has detected change in the generation number.
Mobility switches advertise the generation numbers for the mapped
mobility vlans in the mobility domain. Generation numbers are used to
detect stale mobility vlans. The mobility vlan name, mobility switch
generation number and the peer switch generation number is passed as parameter.
This is enabled by default.
This object specifies the name of the mobility VLAN.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxMobilityVlanName

description: This object identifies the self generation number associated with
the mobility VLAN in the WSP device. This number will be
received by the WSP during a MVT download.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxMobilityVlanSelfGenerationNumber

description: This object identifies the peer generation number for each
mobility VLAN received from the WSP (during VLAN advertisements).
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxMobilityVlanPeerGenerationNumber

description: A avWlanSwitchVlanRoleChanged trap signifies that the SNMP entity
acting in an agent role, has changed the role of the mobility vlan.
Mobility vlan name, old and new role, reason for the role change
is passed as parameter.
The trap is Disabled by default.

event.Summary: VLAN $v1 role changed to $v3 because of $v4

description: This object specifies the name of the mobility VLAN.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxMobilityVlanName

description: This object specifies the old role of the mobility VLAN.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxOldVlanRole

description: This object specifies the new role of the mobility VLAN.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxNewVlanRole

description: This object specifies the reason for change in mobility VLAN role
by this WSP. The following values are supported:
administrator - role change due to admin configuration
clientRoam - role change due to client roaming.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxRoleChangeReason

description: A avWlanSwitchVlanMapStateChanged trap signifies that the SNMP entity
acting in an agent role, has changed the state of the mobility vlan map.
A vlan map is the association between mobility vlan name and the local
static vlan. The state is Active as long as Mobility vlan name and the
local static vlan are active.
Deletion of mobility vlan or the local static vlan results in a
InActive state for a vlan map. Vlan map will become Active if the
mobility vlan is created before the next MVT download. Mobility vlan name,
old, new state and the reason is passed as parameter.
The trap is Disabled by default.

event.Summary: Mobility VLAN map state changed to $v3 because of $v4

description: This object specifies the name of the mobility VLAN.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxMobilityVlanName

description: This object specifies the old state of the mobility vlan MAP.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxOldState

description: This object specifies the new state of the mobility vlan MAP.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxNewState

description: This object specifies the reason for change in mobility VLAN
state in this WSP device. The following values are supported:
mobVlanDeleted - state change due to deletion of mobility VLAN
mobVlanCreated - state change due to creation of mobility VLAN
localVlanDeleted - state change due to deletion of local VLAN
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxStateChangeReason

description: A avWlanSwitchVlanMapRemoved trap signifies that the SNMP entity
acting in an agent role, has deleted the mobility vlan map.
InActive maps are deleted when the mobility vlan is not present in
the MVT download. Active maps are deleted either from the config or
when the lvid to which mobility vlan is mapped is deleted. Mobility
vlan name, vlan state and reason for removal is passed as parameter.
The trap is Enabled by default.

event.Summary: Mobility VLAN $v1 map removed because of $v3

description: This object specifies the name of the mobility VLAN.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxMobilityVlanName

description: This object specifies the current state of the mobility VLAN.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxVlanState

description: This object specifies the reason for removal of mobility VLAN
in this WSP. The following values are supported:
administrator - removed due to admin configuration
clientRoam - removed due to deletion of lvid.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxRemoveReason

description: A avWlanSwitchVlanTrackAffected trap signifies that the SNMP entity
acting in an agent role, has detected a mobility vlan in server role has no ports
active in its track list. Mobility vlan name is passed as parameter.
The trap is Disabled by default.

event.Summary: Mobility VLAN $v1 in server role without active port in track list

description: This object specifies the name of the mobility VLAN.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxMobilityVlanName

description: A avWlanSwitchIgmpSnoopingEnabled trap signifies that the SNMP entity
acting in an agent role, has successfully enabled IGMP snooping on a mobility vlan.
local vlan identifier which is mapped to mobility vlan is passed as parameter.
The trap is Disabled by default.
This object specifies the name of the mobility VLAN.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxMobilityVlanName

description: A avWlanSwitchIgmpSnoopingDisabled trap signifies that the SNMP entity
acting in an agent role, has successfully disabled IGMP snooping
on a mobility vlan. Mobility vlan name is passed as parameter. The trap is
Disabled by default.
This object specifies the name of the mobility VLAN.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxMobilityVlanName

description: A avWlanSwitchIgmpControlFrameReceived trap signifies that the SNMP entity
acting in an agent role, has snooped IGMP control frame on a mobility vlan.
Mobility vlan name, Frame Type, device type and IGMP source IP
are passed as parameters. The trap is Disabled by default.

event.Summary: WLAN switch IGMP control frame $v2 received

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanSwitchIgmpControlFrameReceived AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxMobilityVlanName s EXAMPLE AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxControlFrameType i 1 AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxPeerDeviceType i 1 AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxInetAddressType i 0 AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxInetAddress s EXAMPLE

description: This object specifies the name of the mobility VLAN.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxMobilityVlanName

description: This object specifies the IGMP control frame type.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxControlFrameType

description: This object specifies the peer device type.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxPeerDeviceType

description: The type of address contained in a corresponding instance of
avWlanNotifAuxInetAddress.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxInetAddressType

description: This object identifies the source IP in the IGMP control frame.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanNotifAuxInetAddress

description: This trap signifies that the SNMP entity, acting in an agent role,
has detected some switch limits being reached.
The bit mask avWlanSwitchNotifAuxLimitsReached is send in the trap
to indicate the parameter for which limits are reached.
This trap is enabled by default.

event.Summary: WLAN switch limit reached because of $v1

description: This objects is included in the avWlanSwitchLimitsReached notification to
indicate which limits have been reached.
variables.name: AVAYA-WLAN-MOB-SW-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::avWlanSwitchNotifAuxAuxLimitsReached
